channel.title: Getting Started with Photoshop
channel.description:
Okay so you just got photoshop and wanna make some leet haxxor stuff eh?
Just the right thread ;)
[u]Installing Brushes[/u]
First you need to download some brushes into your computer.
Go to http://deviantart.com or any other places that have good photoshop brushes. Also, see my stickie.
Un zip the brushes, go to my computer> C drive> adobe> photoshop cs2> Presets> brushes> then copy and paste the brush files into there, then you can delete the .zip.
[u]Installing Fonts[/u]
1. Download some fonts. 2. Good site for fonts: http://dafont.com 3. Go to My Computer 4. Go to C drive or your default harddrive. 5. Search for FONTS. 6. once found correct folder add the font files.
Other way to add fonts, some XP Home edition computer have a 'FONTS' folder inside the control panel.
[u]Im ready![/u]
First you need to get used to the options!
Make a white background canvas. Go to Filter. Play with the settings, clouds, gaugasion blur etc. then once you get used to the settings click the brush icon Now click the arrow and select your brush set. Start brushing all over the canvas and just have fun and experiment.
[color=red]To see more tutorials visit [url=http://spiced-fx.com]Spiced-Fx[/url] :D.

item.title: Getting Started with Photoshop
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

Okay so you just got photoshop and wanna make some leet haxxor stuff eh?

Just the right thread

Installing Brushes

First you need to download some brushes into your computer.

Go to http://deviantart.com or any other places that have good photoshop brushes. Also, see my stickie.

Un zip the brushes, go to my computer> C drive> adobe> photoshop cs2> Presets> brushes> then copy and paste the brush files into there, then you can delete the .zip.

Installing Fonts

  1. Download some fonts.
  2. Good site for fonts: http://dafont.com
  3. Go to My Computer
  4. Go to C drive or your default harddrive.
  5. Search for FONTS.
  6. once found correct folder add the font files.

Other way to add fonts, some XP Home edition computer have a ‘FONTS’ folder inside the control panel.

Im ready!

First you need to get used to the options!

Make a white background canvas.
Go to Filter.
Play with the settings, clouds, gaugasion blur etc.
then once you get used to the settings click the brush icon
Now click the arrow and select your brush set.
Start brushing all over the canvas and just have fun and experiment.

[color=red]To see more tutorials visit Spiced-Fx :D.

Read full topic
